greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n is prime then a(n) = n; for the subsequent nonprime positions a(n + k) = (k+1)*n; then at the next prime position a new subsequence begins.
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
mathematica: a[n_?PrimeQ] := n; a[n_] := NextPrime[n, -1]*(n - NextPrime[n, -1] + 1); Table[a[n], {n, 2, 64}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 19 2011 *)
program: (PARI) { for (n=2, 10000, if (isprime(n), a=m=n; k=2, a=k*m; k++); write("b064924.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 29 2009
a064924_list = concat $ zipWith (\p g -> genericTake g [p, 2 * p ..])
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 14 2001
